snippet: A new Commonwealth Fund report finds that people are increasingly skipping needed health care because they can’t afford it. On the plus side, more young adults are insured.
abstract: A new Commonwealth Fund report finds that people are increasingly skipping needed health care because they can’t afford it. On the plus side, more young adults are insured.

headline.main: About Half of Adults Lacked Adequate Health Coverage in 2012
